title: Error: Transaction reverted without a reason string at <UnrecognizedContract>.<unknown>

body:
This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-438/error-transaction-reverted-without-a-reason-string-at).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: c38adab0-a9ba-45bd-8637-95a3eaee6664

If you're using MetaMask you may need to reset the nonce value of the account and to do that go to Settings->Advanced->Reset Account and Reset it.
You'll need to do this every time you start a node if on your previous run you performed a write transaction (increases nonce) from that account.
This issue was marked as stale because it didn't have any activity in the last 30 days. If you think it's still relevant, please leave a comment indicating so. Otherwise, it will be closed in 7 days.
This doesn't seem like a bug in Hardhat, so I'm going to close this. Feel free to add more info and we can reopen if necessary!

The topic is relevant! I also faced such a problem!  how to fix it ?

```
Contract call:       <UnrecognizedContract>
  Transaction:         0xba81139ec089f6161ecb938590163213030f49dde38e433298d46881ee432276
  From:                0x70997970c51812dc3a010c7d01b50e0d17dc79c8
  To:                  0x5fbdb2315678afecb367f032d93f642f64180aa3
  Value:               2 ETH
  Gas used:            31126 of 40000
  Block #3:            0xb7d83a23baae6de92d71673b6a8ab7e51e7732e4ab3e95ed1039844647b839e3

net_version
eth_call
  Contract call:       <UnrecognizedContract>
  From:                0xf39fd6e51aad88f6f4ce6ab8827279cfffb92266
  To:                  0x5fbdb2315678afecb367f032d93f642f64180aa3

  Error: Transaction reverted without a reason string
      at <UnrecognizedContract>.<unknown> (0x5fbdb2315678afecb367f032d93f642f64180aa3)
      at HardhatNode.runCall (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\node.ts:615:20)
      at EthModule._callAction (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\modules\eth.ts:353:9)
      at HardhatNetworkProvider._sendWithLogging (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\provider.ts:139:22)
      at HardhatNetworkProvider.request (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\provider.ts:116:18)
      at JsonRpcHandler._handleRequest (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\jsonrpc\handler.ts:188:20)
      at JsonRpcHandler._handleSingleRequest (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\jsonrpc\handler.ts:167:17)
      at Server.JsonRpcHandler.handleHttp (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\jsonrpc\handler.ts:52:21)
```

> The topic is relevant! I also faced such a problem! how to fix it ?

>       at <UnrecognizedContract>.<unknown> (0x5fbdb2315678afecb367f032d93f642f64180aa3)
>       at HardhatNode.runCall (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\node.ts:615:20)
>       at EthModule._callAction (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\modules\eth.ts:353:9)
>       at HardhatNetworkProvider._sendWithLogging (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\provider.ts:139:22)
>       at HardhatNetworkProvider.request (C:\Users\wasab\Desktop\hardhat2\node_modules\hardhat\src\internal\hardhat-network\provider\provider.ts:116:18)

@yablados  Have you had any luck figuring it out?
You may be calling a wrong contract address. Address may change after a new deploy. Make sure you're calling the newest contract address.

I've had the same issue for days and the solution for me was just to use ganache or geth in the end when I wanted to interact with my contract through Metamask... The contracts work in the hardhat network through the default provider, but not through Metamask while sending ETH works fine on Metamask on the hardhat node. Changing chainID to 1337 doesn't solve this. Tried both 1337 and 31337 and created new networks in Metamask and it just doesn't work in the hardhat node. The exact same setup works out of the box on ganache and geth.
